key.name: general-management-url
key.description: Management Service URL [http|https]://[host]:[port] (default "https://api.netbird.io:443")

key.name: general-admin-url
key.description: Admin Panel URL [http|https]://[host]:[port] (default "https://app.netbird.io:443")

key.name: general-anonymize
key.description: Anonymize IP addresses and non-netbird.io domains in logs and status output

key.name: general-daemon-addr
key.description: Daemon service address to serve CLI requests [unix|tcp]://[path|host:port] (default "unix:///var/run/netbird.sock")

key.name: general-hostname
key.description: Sets a custom hostname for the device

key.name: general-log-file
key.description: Sets NetBird log paths written to simultaneously. If console is specified the log will be output to stdout. If syslog is specified the log will be sent to syslog daemon. (default "/var/log/netbird/client.log")

key.name: general-log-level
key.description: Sets NetBird log level (default "info")

key.name: general-preshared-key
key.description: Sets WireGuard PreSharedKey property. If set, then only peers that have the same key can communicate.

key.name: general-service
key.description: Netbird system service name (default "netbird")

key.name: general-setup-key
key.description: Setup key obtained from the Management Service Dashboard (used to register peer)

key.name: general-setup-key-file
key.description: The path to a setup key obtained from the Management Service Dashboard (used to register peer). This is ignored if the setup-key flag is provided.

key.name: up-allow-server-ssh
key.description: If enabled, the SSH server will be permitted

key.name: up-block-inbound
key.description: If enabled, the client will not allow any inbound connections to the local machine nor routed networks. This overrides any policies received from the management service.

key.name: up-block-lan-access
key.description: Block access to local networks (LAN) when using this peer as a router or exit node

key.name: up-disable-auto-connect
key.description: Disables auto-connect feature. If enabled, then the client won't connect automatically when the service starts.

key.name: up-disable-client-routes
key.description: If enabled, the client won't process client routes received from the management service.

key.name: up-disable-server-routes
key.description: If enabled, the client won't act as a router for server routes received from the management service.

key.name: up-disable-dns
key.description: If enabled, the client won't configure DNS settings.

key.name: up-dns-resolver-address
key.description: Sets a custom address for NetBird's local DNS resolver. If set, the agent won't attempt to discover the best ip and port to listen on. An empty string "" clears the previous configuration. E.g. 127.0.0.1:5053

key.name: up-dns-router-interval
key.description: DNS route update interval (default 1m0s)

key.name: up-extra-dns-labels
key.description: Sets DNS labels. You can specify a comma-separated list of up to 32 labels. An empty string "" clears the previous configuration. E.g. vpc1,mgmt1

key.name: up-disable-firewall
key.description: If enabled, the client won't modify firewall rules.

key.name: up-interface-name
key.description: WireGuard interface name (default "wt0")

key.name: up-mtu
key.description: Set MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) for the WireGuard interface (default 1280)

key.name: up-wireguard-port
key.description: WireGuard interface listening port (default 51820)

key.name: up-external-ip-map
key.description: Sets external IPs maps between local addresses and interfaces. You can specify a comma-separated list with a single IP and IP/IP or IP/Interface Name. E.g. 12.34.56.78/10.0.0.1 or 12.34.56.200,12.34.56.78/10.0.0.1,12.34.56.80/eth1

key.name: up-extra-iface-blacklist
key.description: Extra list of default interfaces to ignore for listening

key.name: up-network-monitor
key.description: Manage network monitoring. Defaults to true on Windows and macOS, false on Linux and FreeBSD.

key.name: up-enable-lazy-connection
key.description: If enabled, the client will establish connections on-demand. Note: this setting may be overridden by management configuration.

key.name: up-enable-rosenpass
key.description: If enabled, the connection will be post-quantum secured via Rosenpass.

key.name: up-rosenpass-permissive
key.description: Enable Rosenpass in permissive mode to allow this peer to accept WireGuard connections without requiring Rosenpass functionality from peers that do not have Rosenpass enabled.

key.name: up-no-browser
key.description: Do not open the browser for SSO login

key.name: up-profile
key.description: Profile name to use for the login. If not specified, the last used profile will be used.
